evidence.text:
Person A: Hi Norma.
Person A: Shit. Baby, we should go.
Person B: No mama! Stay!

Person B: It’s my fault he doesn’t sleep. I shouldn’t be mad at him. Everyone said it and I just didn’t listen because I liked holding him while he slept on my chest like a little warm heater. But if I had put him down drowsy but awake like all the books said then he would have good sleep habits for his entire life, I would always have a clean kitchen and a good sex life, and everything would be amazing. So now that I fucked that up... now what?
Person A: Mama! Horsey!
Person A: Mama fuzzy!
Person B: Baby - show daddy how you balance your trains! He hasn’t seen that.

Person B: Happiness is a choice. Happiness is a choice. Happiness is a choice. What’s up with that duck? What’s up with that duck? UGH! Fuck. Stop!
Person B: I need to just enjoy these moments with him. He’s going to grow up and I will be sad these days are gone. But I’m lonely. I can’t believe how alone I feel considering I’m never actually alone.
Person B: How can I still have dinner, and bath and books to get through before this day is over? What’s up with that duck? What’s up with that duck?
Person B: Look at you! You’re so beautiful. And you smell good. Like fresh strawberries. Did you just have a bath?
Person B: We’re coming with you!

Person B: Are any of these other mothers also losing their minds while they wheel through the grocery store buying crunchy snacks? We need some crunchy snacks, right?
Person A: Cookies! Cookies cookies cookies.
Person B: Oh my gosh, Hi Sally! What are you doing here?

Person B: Baby! Squirrel! Let’s get it.
Person B: Maybe it’s really this simple. It just instinct. We’re animals. He’s my cub. We eat and play and this is life.
Person B: I’ve never felt this hungry in my life. Ravenous is the word. Ravenous, baby.
Person B: I think I’m anemic.
Person B: Mmmm.
Person B: Here baby, eat.

Person A: Grrrrr.
Person B: Speak!
Person B: Just a lil’ party trick we’ve been working on.

Person B: Oh honey.
Person B: Baby? BABY!
Person B: Have you seen a little blond boy?

Person B: He said salmon not Santa, baby.
Person A: Okay I got blackberries and Santa’s candy canes... and his head.
